vyra_base.com.feeder package¶

Submodules¶

vyra_base.com.feeder.available_module_feeder module¶

vyra_base.com.feeder.error_feeder module¶

class vyra_base.com.feeder.error_feeder.ErrorFeeder(type, node, module_config, loggingOn=False)¶

Bases: BaseFeeder

Collection of the error messages

build_errorfeed(errorDict)¶

Builds a error entry from the given keyword arguments. :type errorDict: dict :param errorDict: A dictionary containing error details.

Keywords are: - ‘code’: int16 - Error code (default: 0x00000000) - ‘uuid’: UUID - Unique identifier for the error (default: a new UUID) - ‘description’: str - Description of the error (default: ‘’) - ‘solution’: str - Suggested solution for the error (default: ‘’) - ‘miscellaneous’: str - Additional information (default: ‘’) - ‘level’: ErrorEntry.ERROR_LEVEL - Level of the error

(default: ErrorEntry.ERROR_LEVEL.MINOR_FAULT)

Returns:

An instance of ErrorEntry populated with the provided details.

Return type:

ErrorEntry

feed(errorElement)¶

Feed a news entry to the feeder. The content can either be a string which will be processed into an ErrorEntry if a dict is given, or a ErrorEntry object itself. Use the method build_errorfeed to create an ErrorEntry from a dict. :type errorElement: Union[ErrorEntry, dict] :param errorElement: The error entry to be fed.

Can be a dictionary with error details or an ErrorEntry object.

Raises:

FeederException – If the type of errorElement is neither a dict nor an ErrorEntry.

Return type:

None

vyra_base.com.feeder.feeder module¶

class vyra_base.com.feeder.feeder.BaseFeeder(loggingOn=False)¶

Bases: object

Abstract class

Abstraction that provides the required interface for deuque method all inheriting deque objects require to work.

add_handler(handler)¶

Add a communication handler to the feeder.

Return type:

bool

create(loggingOn=False)¶
Return type:

None

create_feeder()¶

Set the logger for the feeder.

feed(msg)¶
Return type:

None

vyra_base.com.feeder.news_feeder module¶

class vyra_base.com.feeder.news_feeder.NewsFeeder(type, node, module_config, loggingOn=False)¶

Bases: BaseFeeder

Collection of the news messages

build_newsfeed(*args)¶

Building a well structured newsfeed entry from plain text and module information :type *args: Any :param *args: The arguments to be processed into a news entry.

Can be a string or list of strings.

Returns:

A structured news entry containing the message, level, timestamp, UUID, module name, module ID, module template, and type.

Return type:

NewsEntry

Raises:

FeederException – If the type of the message level is not valid.

feed(newsElement)¶

Feed a news entry to the feeder. The content can either be a string which will be processed into a NewsEntry, or a NewsEntry object itself. Use the method build_newsfeed to create a NewsEntry from a string or list. :type newsElement: Union[NewsEntry, str, list] :param newsElement: The news entry to be fed.

Can be a string or list of strings to be processed into a NewsEntry, or a NewsEntry object.

Raises:

FeederException – If the type of newsElement is not supported.

Return type:

None

vyra_base.com.feeder.news_feeder.extract_level_from_msg(message)¶

Extracts the message level from a given message string. :type message: str :param message: The message string from which to extract the level. :type message: str

Returns:

The extracted message level if found, otherwise None.

Return type:

Union[NewsEntry.MESSAGE_LEVEL, None]

vyra_base.com.feeder.state_feeder module¶

class vyra_base.com.feeder.state_feeder.StateFeeder(type, node, module_config, loggingOn=False)¶

Bases: BaseFeeder

Resposible for loading a ROS2 Handler and feeding StateEntry elements to this handler.

feed(stateElement)¶

Adds value to the logger and the remote handler

Return type:

None
